abstract: On Oct. 4, 1957, the Soviet Union put the first artificial satellite, Sputnik I, into the Earth's orbit, signifying the birth of the Space Age.
snippet: On Oct. 4, 1957, the Soviet Union put the first artificial satellite, Sputnik I, into the Earth's orbit, signifying the birth of the Space Age.
lead_paragraph: On Oct. 4, 1957, the Soviet Union put the first artificial satellite, Sputnik I, into the Earth's orbit, signifying the birth of the Space Age. The spherical satellite, which was about the size of a beach ball and weighed 184 pounds, was able to orbit the Earth in 98 minutes.

headline.main: Oct. 4, 1957 | Soviet Union Launches Sputnik Satellite
